amendment.description: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 2 in the Congressional Record of July 24, 1995, to appropriate $290 million for low-income housing drug elimination grants and drug information programs. The funds would be offset by reductions in the appropriation for FEMA disaster relief.

action.text: Mr. Lewis (CA) raised a point of order against the Kaptur amendment (A007). Mr. Lewis (CA) stated that the amendment proposed changes to existing law and constituted legislation on an appropriations bill and was, therefore, in violation of the rules of the House. The Chair sustained the point of order.
